trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Egnyte | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Egnyte | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Egnyte with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Egnyte with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Egnyte.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Egnyte.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Egnyte single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An Egnyte single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Egnyte will be able to single sign into the application at your Egnyte company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Egnyte will be able to single sign into the application at your Egnyte company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Egnyte
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Egnyte

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Egnyte.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Egnyte.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type egnyte.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type egnyte.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Egnyte, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Egnyte, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Egnyte</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Egnyte</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Egnyte with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Egnyte with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Egnyte application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Egnyte application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Egnyte page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Egnyte page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Egnyte Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.egnyte.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Egnyte Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.egnyte.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Egnyte company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Egnyte company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu, click Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu, click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Configuration tab, and then click Security.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configuration tab, and then click Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On Authentication section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On Authentication section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign On Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign On Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Single sign-on authentication, select SAML 2.0.
trans-unit.target: As Single sign-on authentication, select SAML 2.0.

trans-unit.source: As Identity provider, select AzureAD.
trans-unit.target: As Identity provider, select AzureAD.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the *Identity provider login URL * textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the *Identity provider login URL * textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Identity provider entity ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Egnyte dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Identity provider entity ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity provider certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity provider certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Default user mapping, select Email address.
trans-unit.target: As Default user mapping, select Email address.

trans-unit.source: As Use domain-specific issuer value, select disabled.
trans-unit.target: As Use domain-specific issuer value, select disabled.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Egnyte, they must be provisioned into Egnyte.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Egnyte, they must be provisioned into Egnyte.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Egnyte, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Egnyte, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Egnyte Egnyte company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Egnyte Egnyte company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Settings \> Users & Groups.
trans-unit.target: Go to Settings \> Users & Groups.

trans-unit.source: Click Add New User, and then select the type of user you want to add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add New User, and then select the type of user you want to add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New Standard User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the New Standard User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Standard User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Standard User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email, Username and other details of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email, Username and other details of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive a notification email.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive a notification email.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Egnyte user account creation tools or APIs provided by Egnyte to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Egnyte user account creation tools or APIs provided by Egnyte to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Egnyte **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Egnyte **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
